result.execSummary:
The defendant Dillon J Votis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 1 day only if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars.

The defendant may not have any contact with Jacob or John Aschenbrenner.

The defendant must attend and successfully complete an anger management assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must submit a DNA sample.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Huber allowed - Court has no objections to allowing the defendant to serve his time on weekends but it is the ultimate decision of the Sheriff.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Dillon J Votis in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:20 PM. State - resolved - have complied with victim notification requirements with no response or VIS - amend #1 to misd battery contrary to 940.19(1), plead to amended count #1 and #3 as alleged, #2 - DRI,  withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: count #1 - 10 days conditional jail with $500;00 fine plus costs and surcharges, #3 - costs only, other conditions include: AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, absolute sobriety, 50 hours of community service, no contact with John or Jacob Aschenbrenner. Votis and Cirilli agree. Court dismisses and reads in count #2. Court amends count #1 to misd battery contrary to 940.19(1) - reads new charge and penalty. Votis pleads NC to count #1 as amended and count #3 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Cirilli makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - leaves the condition of anger management assessment up to the Court - asking that the defendant be allowed to do his jail time on weekends for stated reasons (employment). Votis makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: count #1 - 10 days conditional jail - huber allowed  - credit for 1 day only if revoked - report at 8:30 AM on Friday, 9/2/16 and has no objections to the Sheriff allowing him to serve his sentence on weekend but it is the ultimate decsion of the Sheriff, $500.00 fine plus costs and surcharge, #3 - costs , other conditions on both counts includes: AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 50 hours of community service, no contact with John or Jacob Aschenbrenner, submit DNA sample with surcharges and expunction rights, right to appeal, adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 31, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Respondent's Response to State's Demand for Discovery
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 3, 2016 at 10:45 am.

Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Votis understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, can afford his own. Court sets for AIA. State asks for additional condition of no contact with Jacob of John Aschenbrenner. Court so orders.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.
